hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Spike Fade in Low-Volatility Regimes
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a >4% single-day price spike in BTC driven by identifiable positive news headlines, a short entry at the New York market open (09:30 ET) the next day will be profitable, provided the 20-day historical volatility is below 40% (indicating a low-volatility regime).
hypothesis_content.rationale: In low-volatility, neutral regimes, large single-day moves are often driven by short-term news flow and are prone to quick retracements as the initial emotional reaction fades and liquidity is absorbed. The MOO entry avoids the overnight gap risk and captures the 'morning after' sentiment check.
entry_conditions: The spike is accompanied by 2+ major news headlines tagged as 'positive' by a news sentiment engine
Entry: Market on Open (MOO) at 09:30 ET the following trading day

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the previous day's spike (from open to close)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price exceeds the previous day's high by 0.5%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The hypothesis is falsified if the strategy's Sharpe Ratio is below 0.5 or if more than 60% of trades hit their stop-loss before their take-profit or time exit over a minimum of 25 occurrences.
